content: It would actually make sense for Bush to have pardoned Osama. The FBI admitted that there is "no hard evidence connecting Bin Laden to 9/11." Therefore, if Osama were put on trial he would most likely be found not guilty. Therefore, a pardon would spare Bush the embarrassment of such a verdict and also serve to perpetuate the myth that Osama really was responsible for 9/11. >http://www.911truth.org/article.php?story=20060611155014535 Bush, having access to intelligence reports not available to the general public, was probably aware that Osama is most likely already dead, which is another reason a pardon would not have been particularly outrageous. >http://whatreallyhappened.com/WRHARTICLES/osama_dead.html
